results.title: Tina Peters, an indicted county clerk, loses the G.O.P. primary for Colorado secretary of state to Pam Anderson.
results.abstract: Ms. Peters, who has become a celebrity in far-right circles, was beaten by Ms. Anderson, a longtime election official who has been a vocal opponent of misinformation about the 2020 contest.

media.caption: Tina Peters is one of several Republican candidates for secretary of state across the country who deny the legitimacy of the 2020 election.
media.copyright: Daniel Brenner for The New York Times

results.title: Supreme Court Narrows Ruling for Tribes in Oklahoma
results.abstract: The decision followed a landmark 2020 decision that said much of eastern Oklahoma falls within an Indian reservation, limiting the authority of state prosecutors.

media.caption: The landmark ruling in 2020, McGirt v. Oklahoma, said that Native Americans who commit crimes on the reservation cannot be prosecuted by state or local law enforcement.
media.copyright: Michael Noble Jr./Tulsa World, via Associated Press

results.title: Margaret Keane, Painter of Sad-Eyed Waifs, Dies at 94
results.abstract: Her work was immensely popular and virtually ubiquitous. But until the matter was settled in court, her husband fraudulently claimed credit for it.

media.caption: The artist Margaret Keane at work in her home studio in a photo taken for a 1965 article in Life magazine, with her husband, Walter, in the background. It was later revealed that he took credit for work that was actually hers.
media.copyright: Photo by Bill Ray/The LIFE Picture Collection/Getty Images

results.title: For Many Women, Roe Was About More Than Abortion. It Was About Freedom.
results.abstract: After the reversal of Roe v. Wade, some women are reconsidering their plans, including where they live, and wondering how best to channel their anger.
des_facet: Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision)

media.caption: Yolanda Williams plans to live in rural Georgia with her daughter. She has considered whether they should live in a state where abortion could soon be severely restricted, but is unsure which corner of the country could be better.
media.copyright: Nina Robinson for The New York Times

results.title: 101-Year-Old Ex-Guard at Nazi Camp Is Convicted by German Court
results.abstract: The man, identified only as Josef S. because of German privacy laws, was sentenced to five years in prison after being found guilty of being an accessory to more than 3,500 murders.

results.title: Fauci says he believes Paxlovid kept him out of the hospital, even though he tested positive again.
results.abstract: Dr. Anthony Fauci, President Biden’s top pandemic adviser, sought to discourage doubts about the antiviral drug Paxlovid following what appeared to be a “rebound” of Covid-19 after taking the pills.

media.caption: “I’m 81 years old, I was at risk for hospitalization and I didn’t even come close to being sick enough to be hospitalized,” Dr. Anthony S. Fauci, pictured earlier this month, said on Wednesday.
